niche.tagline: Help neurodivergent clients thrive â€” not just cope

method.name: F.O.C.U.S. Methodâ„¢
method.fullTitle: The F.O.C.U.S. Methodâ„¢ for ADHD Coaching
method.description: A structured 5-step framework that helps neurodivergent clients build systems that work WITH their brain, not against it. Instead of forcing neurotypical productivity hacks, the F.O.C.U.S. Method meets clients where they are and builds sustainable routines around their unique wiring.

steps.title: Find the Pattern
steps.description: Identify repeating ADHD-driven behaviors, triggers, and cycles that keep the client stuck. Map the real patterns â€” not the ones they think they have.

steps.title: Optimize the Environment
steps.description: Restructure the client's physical and digital environment to reduce friction and create automatic cues for action.

steps.title: Create the System
steps.description: Design personalized productivity systems, routines, and rituals that align with ADHD hyperfocus and energy cycles.

steps.title: Uplift Confidence
steps.description: Rebuild self-trust through small wins. Address the shame spiral that keeps most ADHD adults from trying new approaches.

steps.title: Sustain the Momentum
steps.description: Build accountability structures and reward systems that prevent the common ADHD pattern of 'start strong, abandon fast.'

examQuestions.question: What is the primary neurotransmitter associated with ADHD that affects motivation and reward?
examQuestions.explanation: Dopamine is the primary neurotransmitter involved in ADHD. Low dopamine activity affects motivation, reward processing, and executive function.

examQuestions.question: What does the 'F' in the F.O.C.U.S. Methodâ„¢ stand for?
examQuestions.explanation: The 'F' stands for 'Find the Pattern' â€” identifying repeating ADHD-driven behaviors, triggers, and cycles that keep the client stuck.

examQuestions.question: Why do ADHD clients often prefer intensive coaching formats over weekly sessions?
options: They align better with ADHD hyperfocus cycles and prevent momentum loss
examQuestions.explanation: Intensive formats work with ADHD hyperfocus patterns and prevent the common dropout that happens between widely spaced weekly sessions.

examQuestions.question: What is the 'ADHD Shame Spiral'?
options: A cleaning method for ADHD homes
A cycle where repeated failure creates a fixed mindset and avoidance
A type of ADHD medication side effect
examQuestions.explanation: The ADHD shame spiral is the cycle where years of 'failing' at neurotypical expectations creates deep shame, fixed mindset, and avoidance of new approaches.

examQuestions.question: In the F.O.C.U.S. Methodâ„¢, what does the 'Sustain' step focus on?
options: Building accountability structures and reward systems
examQuestions.explanation: The 'Sustain' step builds accountability structures and reward systems that prevent the common ADHD pattern of 'start strong, abandon fast.'

zombie.name: Brittany
zombie.backstory: Former corporate project manager who got diagnosed with ADHD at 31. Spent years masking and burning out before realizing her own struggles could become her superpower.
zombie.transformation: After completing the training, Brittany started coaching other late-diagnosed ADHD professionals. She uses the F.O.C.U.S. Methodâ„¢ with every client, specializing in career transitions for neurodivergent adults.
zombie.incomeStory: Brittany now earns $5,200/month coaching ADHD professionals â€” working 20 hours a week from her home office. Her waitlist is 3 weeks long.
zombie.writingStyle: Direct, enthusiastic, uses lots of dashes and exclamation points. Occasionally goes on tangents (on brand for ADHD). Authentic and unfiltered.

faq.q: Do I need to have ADHD to be an ADHD coach?
faq.a: No! While many of our coaches are neurodivergent themselves, it's not required. What matters is understanding and genuine empathy.

faq.q: Is this recognized by major ADHD organizations?
faq.a: This Mini Diploma is issued by the Accreditation Standards Institute (ASI) and provides foundational ADHD coaching certification.

faq.q: Can I combine this with other certifications?
faq.a: Absolutely. Many of our graduates combine ADHD coaching with life coaching, health coaching, or counseling credentials.

sarah.credentials: Certified ADHD Coaching Specialist & Neurodivergent Advocate
sarah.storySnippet: When my daughter was diagnosed with ADHD at 8, I dove deep into understanding the neurodivergent brain. That journey led me to develop the F.O.C.U.S. Methodâ„¢ â€” a coaching framework that works WITH the ADHD brain instead of fighting against it.
